dcterms:creator: E.-J. Kuo
Y.-L. L. Fang
S. Y.-C. Chen
dcterms:description: The Bell state is a two-qubit quantum state that is used prominently in quantum computing and quantum communication for the purpose of quantum entanglement. It serves as a target state for generating desired quantum outputs.
dcterms:title: Bell state

dcterms:creator: E.-J. Kuo
Y.-L. L. Fang
S. Y.-C. Chen
dcterms:description: The GHZ state is a three-qubit quantum state that is used in quantum computing and quantum communication, similar to the Bell state but involving three qubits. It serves as a target state for generating desired quantum outputs.
dcterms:title: GHZ state

dcterms:creator: E.-J. Kuo
Y.-L. L. Fang
S. Y.-C. Chen
dcterms:description: The quantum simulator is a computational tool used to simulate quantum systems and their behaviors, allowing for the testing and evaluation of quantum algorithms and architectures in various noise environments.
dcterms:title: Quantum simulator
